P043412.project_name: Morocco Basic Education Reform Support Program

keywords.cdata: achievements, addition, allocative efficiency, Annual Report, audits, Bidding, boarding facilities, community development, cultural norms, decentralization, decentralization process, disability, education programs, education quality, Education Reform, educational opportunities, educational quality, enrollment, expenditures, families, formal education, girls, hazards, higher education reform, housing, Human Development, human resource management, illiteracy, information systems, institutional capacity, instruction, learning, Lessons learned, living standards, Mathematics, Middle East, negotiations, North Africa, Parents, Partnership, primary education, Procurement, procurement procedures, project implementation, Project Preparation, public sector, quality education, quality of education, Reading, repetition, repetition rates, school education, school quality, schooling, schools, secondary education, secondary school students, secondary school teachers, social development, social services, student achievement, Teacher, teacher recruitment, teacher training, teachers, transparency

project_abstract.cdata: The principal objective of the Basic Education Reform Support Program (Programme d'appui a la reforme du systbme educatif marocain-- PARSEM), is to support Government efforts to provide basic education of improving quality to all children ages six to fourteen in a financially sustainable manner in Morocco.  The project consists of three components.  The first, generalize basic education to ensure that basic education is available to most school-age children by 2008.  The second component, improve evaluation systems, including:  improving support services for teachers; promoting the quality of education at the school level; and promoting research to improve the quality of education.  The third component, build institutional capacity will support implementation of public administration reform in the education sector.
